intro: Wyethia californica, commonly known as the California goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow to golden-orange flowers. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Wyethia californica is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
